translated: the world’s elder, the bull of a man,
Having gone out from the city,🔽I went to the Dīpacetiya,
like the Indra’s host of the Thirty.
Having gone out from the dwelling,🔽I raised up a cloth then,
I worshipped with my head (at his feet),
and I took it up for the Great Sage.
Oh the Buddhas, oh the Dhamma,
oh the perfection of our Teacher!
that marvel that made the hairs stand up,
I had confidence in the Buddha,
and having given a cloth to the Teacher,
I did not go to a bad destination,
because of the fruit of my worship of the Buddha.
